<Text:A deposit slip
1:
--------------------
Text: Deposit slip:  The categories include type of item, and if it is a cheque, where it is from such as a local bank or a state if the bank is not local.

Triplets:<Deposit slip
2:
--------------------
Text: Deposit slip:  The teller keeps the deposit slip along with the deposit (cash and cheques), and provides the depositor with a receipt.
Triplets:<Deposit slip
4:
--------------------
Text: Deposit slip:  They also are a means of transport of money.
Triplets:<Deposit slip
5:
--------------------
<Text: Deposit slip:  Pay-in slips encourage the sorting of cash and coins, are filled in and signed by the person who deposited the money, and some tear off from a record that is also filled in by the depositor.>
Triplets:<Deposit slip
6:
--------------------
<Text: Deposit slip:  Deposit slips are also called deposit tickets and come in a variety of designs.>
Triplets:<Deposit slip
7:
--------------------
Text: Deposit slip:  They are signed by the depositor if the depositor is cashing some of the accompanying check and depositing the rest.
